etymology.description: 屮(屮) (chè, "sprout") + dot -> line modified, emphasizing sprout -> modern form 屯
etymology.interpretation: The character 屯 originally depicted a plant sprout, represented by 屮(屮) (chè, "sprout") with a central dot that was later transformed into a horizontal line to emphasize the sprout. It symbolizes the idea of sprouting or beginning, which connects with its broader meaning of 'station,' a place where things start or are based.

examples.chinese: 军队在边境屯(軍隊在邊境屯)，准备随时出击(準備隨時出擊)。
examples.pinyin: Jūnduì zài biānjìng tún, zhǔnbèi suíshí chūjī.
examples.english: The army is stationed at the border, ready to launch an attack at any moment.

examples.chinese: 新军屯(新軍屯)选址在交通枢纽(選址在交通樞紐)，利于快速集结(利於快速集結)。
examples.pinyin: Xīn jūn tún xuǎnzhǐ zài jiāotōng shūniǔ, lì yú kuàisù jíjié.
examples.english: The new military station is located at a transportation hub, which facilitates rapid assembly.
